greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: An inverse Chebyshev transform of (1-x)^2.
comment: Second binomial transform of the expansion of c(-x)^4 (i.e. of (-1)^n*4C(2n+3,n)/(n+4)). The g.f. is transformed to (1-x)^2 under the Chebyshev transformation A(x)->(1/(1+x^2))A(x/(1+x^2)).
link: G. Levy, Solution of second order recurrence equations (2010) PhD Thesis, Florida State University, page 2
formula: D-finite with recurrence: (n+4)*a(n) +2*a(n-1) -4*n*a(n-2)=0. - _R. J. Mathar_, Nov 09 2012
results.author: _Paul Barry_, Oct 13 2004
